briefTitle: A Research Study to Compare Two Semaglutide Medicines in People With Type 2 Diabetes

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes (T2D) mellitus greater than equal to (≥) 180 days before screening.
* Stable daily dose(s) ≥ 90 days prior to the day of screening of metformin ≥ 1500 milligrams (mg) or maximum tolerated or effective dose.
* HbA1c of 7.0-10.5 percentage (%) \[53-91.3 millimoles per mole (mmol/mol)\] (both inclusive).

Exclusion Criteria:

* Known or suspected hypersensitivity to study intervention(s) or related products.
* Treatment with any medication for the indication of diabetes or obesity other than stated in the inclusion criteria within 90 days before screening. However, short term insulin treatment for a maximum of 14 days and prior insulin treatment for gestational diabetes are allowed.
* Uncontrolled and potentially unstable diabetic retinopathy or maculopathy. Verified by a fundus examination performed within 90 days before screening or in the period between screening and randomisation. Pharmacological pupil-dilation is a requirement unless using a digital fundus photography camera specified for nondilated examination.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Glycosylated Haemoglobin (HbA1c)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline (week 0) to end of treatment (week 28) is presented. The endpoint was evaluated based on the data from in-study period. The in-study period is defined as the uninterrupted time interval from date of randomisation to date of least contact with trial site.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Body Weight
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in body weight from baseline (week 0) to end of treatment (week 28) is presented. The endpoint was evaluated based on the data from in-study period. The in-study period is defined as the uninterrupted time interval from date of randomisation to date of least contact with trial site.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
outcomeMeasures.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical study participant that is temporally associated with the use of IMP, whether or not considered related to the IMP. An AE can therefore be any unfavourable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom or disease (new or exacerbated) temporally associated with the use of an IMP. All presented adverse events are TEAE. A TEAE is defined as an adverse event with an onset date (or increase in severity) during the on-treatment observation period. On-treatment observation period is defined as from first drug date until the end of study.

outcomeMeasures.title: Occurrence of Anti-semaglutide Antibodies (Yes/no)
outcomeMeasures.description: Occurrence of anti-semaglutide antibodies for in-study observation period is presented. The in-study period is defined as the uninterrupted time interval from date of randomisation to date of last contact with trial site. In the reported data 'yes' infers who tested positive for anti-semaglutide antibodies, whereas 'No' infers who tested negative for anti semaglutide antibodies.

outcomeMeasures.title: Occurrence of Anti-semaglutide Antibodies With In-vitro Neutralising Effect (Yes/no)
outcomeMeasures.description: Occurrence of anti-semaglutide antibodies with in-vitro neutralizing effect was to be performed based on positive cross -reactivity to GLP-1. Since there was no sample with positive cross -reactivity to GLP-1, no further analysis was performed for invitro neutralizing effect towards native-GLP1. Therefore, no data is available for this end point. In the reported data 'yes' infers who tested positive for anti-semaglutide antibodies whereas 'No' infers who tested negative for anti-semaglutide antibodies.

outcomeMeasures.title: Occurrence of Anti-semaglutide Binding Antibodies Cross-reacting With Endogenous Glucagon Like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) (Yes/no)
outcomeMeasures.description: Occurrence of anti-semaglutide binding antibodies cross-reacting with endogenous glucagon like peptide-1 (GLP-1) for in-study observation period is presented. The in-study period is defined as the uninterrupted time interval from date of randomisation to date of last contact with trial site. In the reported data 'yes' infers who tested positive for anti-semaglutide binding antibodies cross-reacting with endogenous glucagon like peptide-1 (GLP-1) whereas 'No' infers who tested negative for anti-semaglutide binding antibodies cross-reacting with endogenous glucagon like peptide-1 (GLP-1).

outcomeMeasures.title: Occurrence of In-vitro Neutralising Cross-reacting Antibodies to Endogenous GLP-1 (Yes/no)
outcomeMeasures.description: Occurrence of in-vitro neutralising cross-reacting antibodies to endogenous GLP-1 at week 33 is presented. In the reported data 'yes' infers who tested positive for in-vitro neutralising cross-reacting antibodies to endogenous GLP-1 whereas 'No' infers who tested negative for in-vitro neutralising cross-reacting antibodies to endogenous GLP-1.

outcomeMeasures.title: Anti-semaglutide Antibodies Level Measured as Percentage (%) Bound/Total
outcomeMeasures.description: Anti-semaglutide antibodies level measured as %Bound/Total at week 33 is presented.

outcomeMeasures.title: Anti-semaglutide Antibodies Level (Measured as Titre)
outcomeMeasures.description: Anti-semaglutide antibodies level measured as titre at week 33 is presented.
